column4: at some time did you go into the properties of that drive while it was mounted, ie. right clicked and change anything?
Semidious yes I did.  Thats where the problem started.  I went tot he "drive" tab and tried to point it to a folder in my home directory I had created to use as the mount point.

well thats your problem.  I did that to one of mine.  Never really did figure it out but I remembered that error.  I believe you have to reset the prefs of HAL somewhere.  nickrud i'm hoping you know more about this than I do.
